story_overview: The sequence opens in a cool, spacious BLUE with a single ambient sweep to establish mood, then splits into LEFT/RIGHT conversational movement through the verse to build spatial interest. Tension builds through two mirror/locked layers into isolated strobe signature hits for the drops, a gritty digital breakdown that contrasts motion language, and a final release that returns to calm BLUE resolution.

category_scores.reasoning: All plan section boundaries are bar-aligned and implementation metadata states beat_aligned and bar_aligned. Every planned section (e.g., 'intro_1_ambient_establish' bars 1-16, 'verse_1_groove_support' bars 17-32, 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64) begins on downbeats and matches the intended musical phrases, with no off-beat starts.
strengths: Sections start on downbeats and adhere to bar boundaries (implementation: bar_aligned).
'intro_1_ambient_establish' (bars 1-16) and 'verse_1_groove_support' (bars 17-32) respect phrase lengths for establishing and answering.
weaknesses: No explicit sub-bar micro-timing (±50ms) verification beyond metadata; assume bar alignment implies tight sync but micro-adjustments could further tighten hits for percussion accents.

category_scores.reasoning: Energy progression is coherent: low-energy intro (25) → medium verse (55) → tension builds (70-80) → high-energy drops/chorus (90-95) → restrained outro (35). Templates chosen generally match the stated energies. Minor mismatch: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (energy=75) uses two aggressive templates (digital_glitch, random_bounce) which can read slightly higher than the stated intent.
strengths: 'intro_1_ambient_establish' uses a low-energy ambient template (gentle_sweep_breathe) consistent with energy=25.
'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' (bars 57-64) and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' (bars 113-128) reserve high-intensity templates as expected for peaks.
weaknesses: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) pairing digital_glitch + random_bounce may push perceived energy above the stated 75, reducing contrast with the following build.
'build_1_tension_ramp' (bars 41-56) uses locked_with_tremble which can compete with the mirror build if not dialed to lower amplitude.

category_scores.reasoning: Good template variety overall and layering reaches plan target (60% of sections layered). Several layered sections use complementary Left/Right roles (e.g., verse, build_1, chorus_1). However, one layered pairing risks redundancy/chaos: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' stacks two motion-heavy templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce).
strengths: Wide range of templates across the plan (no single template >40% of time).
Layering occurs in 6 of 10 plan sections (60%) which meets the 40-60% target: verse_1, build_1, chorus_1, breakdown_1, build_2, outro_release.
weaknesses: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) layers two fast/dynamic templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce) — overlapping movement types risk visual clutter.
'build_1_tension_ramp' (tension_mirror_build + locked_with_tremble) could become two competing structural layers if tremble amplitude isn't constrained.

category_scores.reasoning: Full song coverage with no temporal gaps or overlaps that create fixture conflicts. Overlapping sections correctly use disjoint fixture groups (LEFT+RIGHT, ODD+EVEN). No instance of ALL overlapping with another group.
strengths: No target conflicts detected: LEFT+RIGHT overlaps (e.g., bars 17-32, 41-56, 65-80, 97-112, 129-164) are valid disjoint pairs.
ODD+EVEN overlap for 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) is valid and avoids conflicts.
weaknesses: Implementation uses 'ALL' for transitions/drops (e.g., 'transition_1_palette_cleanse' bars 33-40, 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64, 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' bars 113-128) — this is safe here but leaves no room for simultaneous secondary layers during those bars; if a future designer attempts to layer, it will create conflicts.

category_scores.reasoning: Strobe usage is conservative and reserved for true peaks. Strobe appears only in 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' (bars 57-64) and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' (bars 113-128) -> 24 strobe bars out of 164 total bars = 14.63% strobe usage, well under the 30% fatigue threshold.
strengths: Strobe limited to major impact moments: 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment'.
Most of the song uses open shutter or pulse for builds and verses, preserving strobe impact.
weaknesses: No specific mention of pulse vs open on medium-energy sections (e.g., 'verse_1_groove_support') — ensure pulses are subtle to avoid creeping strobe-like fatigue.

category_scores.reasoning: Plan defines a coherent 4-scene palette (BLUE, WHITE, RED, PURPLE → BACK TO BLUE) and holds colors across logical transitions. Unique color scenes = 4, within the 3-5 recommended range, and color changes mark major transitions (intro→build→drop→breakdown→resolution).
strengths: Four clear color scenes (BLUE, WHITE, RED, PURPLE) with narrative mapping to energy levels.
Color changes occur at major transitions: e.g., switch to WHITE for tension ('build_1' bars 41-56), RED for drop/chorus ('drop_hit_1' and 'chorus_1').
weaknesses: Implementation doesn't explicitly list colors per implementation section — ensure color holds across adjacent sections (e.g., maintain WHITE through transition_1_palette_cleanse into build_1 to preserve narrative).

category_scores.reasoning: Gobos are used sparingly as planned. Plan applies textures in build and breakdown (clouds in builds, dots in breakdown) and keeps gobo open otherwise. Estimated gobo usage in plan: build_1 (bars 41-56), breakdown_1 (81-96), build_2 (97-112) → 3/10 sections with gobos = 30% gobo usage; open gobo ~70%. This is slightly above the 50-60% open target but still conservative and preserves beam readability during fast movement.
strengths: 'build_1' and 'build_2' (bars 41-56 and 97-112) reserved for cloud-like gobo texture — appropriate for tension.
'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) uses dot/breakup for atmosphere contrast, creating memorable texture moments.
weaknesses: Open gobo is at ~70% (7/10 sections) rather than the ideal 50-60%; result is safe but slightly over-conservative and misses opportunities to texture additional mid-energy moments.
Potential mismatch: complex gobos applied on builds with non-trivial movement (e.g., 'crescendo_sweep_build') risk visual overload unless gobo scale is adjusted.

category_scores.reasoning: Layering depth is strong (6/10 sections layered = 60%), and targeting uses a healthy variety of semantic groups (ALL, LEFT, RIGHT, ODD, EVEN). Channels are coordinated with LEFT/RIGHT dialogues in verse/chorus and ODD/EVEN for breakdown, demonstrating spatial thinking and temporal layering without flattening to ALL.
strengths: Layering present in key moments: verse_1, build_1, chorus_1, breakdown_1, build_2, outro_release (6/10 = 60%).
Good use of semantic target groups: LEFT/RIGHT for dialogue; ODD/EVEN for textural breakdowns.
weaknesses: A few layered pairings (notably 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast') risk being two competing rhythmic layers—consider making one layer structural or tonal to improve depth.
Implementation uses ALL for signature hits which reduces potential for additional layered accents during those same bars.

summary:
Overall the plan and implementation demonstrate a mature, restrained design philosophy: bar-aligned sections, a clear 4-color narrative (BLUE → WHITE → RED → PURPLE → BLUE), and intentional strobe and gobo usage reserved for climactic moments ('drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64 and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' bars 113-128). Layering is deliberately used in 6/10 sections (60%) with LEFT/RIGHT and ODD/EVEN targeting avoiding any fixture conflicts; timing coverage is complete and implementation is beat-aligned.

Primary areas to tighten are micro-level layering compatibility and texture assignment. Specifically, 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) layers two aggressive motion templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce) that can compete visually; consider converting one layer to a subtle texture or slower rhythmic pulse. Also verify gobo scale on fast sweep builds so patterns read cleanly (see 'crescendo_sweep_build' bars 97-112). Overall, this is a high-quality plan and implementation that passes the 70 threshold comfortably.
actionable_feedback: Breakdown layering fix: For 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96), change one layer to a slower texture or tonal layer — e.g., replace random_bounce with a muted 'low_pulse_dimmer' or 'soft_spot_hold' to create contrast with digital_glitch.

Tremble restraint in build_1: In 'build_1_tension_ramp' (bars 41-56) lower locked_with_tremble amplitude or change it to 'locked_subtle_tremble' so tension_mirror_build remains the dominant structural element.

Gobo usage tuning: Move one gobo texture from build_2 ('crescendo_sweep_build' bars 97-112) to a later sub-section or reduce gobo scale when paired with fast sweeps. If gobo must be present on sweep, use large-scale breakup or very soft edge gobos to maintain beam legibility.

Color hold guidance: Ensure 'transition_1_palette_cleanse' (bars 33-40) remains in WHITE and flows into 'build_1' WHITE to avoid an unnecessary color flicker; reserve RED for 'drop_hit_1' and 'chorus_1' to keep the RED scene impactful.

ALL usage strategy: Consider changing one of the ALL signature bars to LEFT+RIGHT with a synchronized quick ALL flash at the downbeat to allow layered accents directly before/after the main ALL hit. For example, make 'drop_hit_1' use a 1-bar ALL impact at the downbeat and surrounding 1–2 bars use LEFT/RIGHT accents so secondary layers can sit adjacent without conflict.

Micro-timing: Though implementation is bar_aligned, audition ±1-2 sub-beat offsets for percussion-heavy hits (e.g., the initial hit of 'drop_hit_1') to tighten perceived synchronization with percussive transients.

shutter_issues: No major issues; ensure medium-energy pulses (verse) remain subtle and not strobe-like.
color_issues: Ensure transition_1_palette_cleanse holds WHITE into build_1 to avoid distracting micro-changes.
gobo_issues: Gobos on fast sweeps (e.g., 'crescendo_sweep_build') must be large-scale or low-contrast to avoid busy visual noise.
visual_impact_issues: Breakdown layering and gobo scale could be tuned to increase clarity of peak moments.
